availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Salem P. Cope (Graves County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Cope. Father of John Cope, Milton Cope, Rebecca Cope, Salem Cope, Lizzie W. Cope, and Carrie Cope. Physician in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 319.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 35.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Precinct 3, p. 27A.
"Salem Prather Cope (1826-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial #59403197, accessed August 29, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59403197.
